Quick Facts

EXIT   X

HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK

Page

Table of Contents

 

 

Throughout this course we will make references to certain types and groups of people. Here is a short description of each:

 

Click the buttons below for more information

 

 

Literally, a Person Conducting a Business or Undertaking. This includes employers, corporations, associations, partnerships, sole traders and volunteer organisations. It covers both profit and not-for-profit organisations. This group bears the primary duty of care for work health and safety.  

 

 

Any person who works for a PCBU including employees, contractors, sub-contractors, apprentices, trainees, volunteers, etcetera.

 

 

Any person who is involved in a business’s decision-making process, has the capacity to significantly affect the entity's financial standing, or is appointed as an officer of an unincorporated association.

 

 

A person, association or group legally incorporated in a corporation. For clarity, we will use “corporation” throughout this course.
